questions.question: Which is a mood stabiliser with an anti-suicidal role?

A 25-year-old man is brought to the psychiatry OPD by his mother with complaints that hehas been behaving aggressively for the last 10 days. He believes he owns the biggestautomobile company in the world and talks about how his made-up company will putsatellites into space someday. She also says that he sleeps for only 3 hours a day. Which of thefollowing drugs cannot be used to treat this patient?
questions.explanation: The clinical features given are suggestive of acute mania in this patient and lamotrigine is notindicated in this condition.It requires a slow, extended titration to minimize the risk of Stevens-Johnson syndrome and isused for maintenance therapy in bipolar disorder.Lithium, sodium valproate, carbamazepine, and atypical antipsychotics are indicated in acutemania.Lithium is indicated in both acute mania and maintenance therapy.

questions.question: A patient is being treated with lithium for manic-depressive psychosis. Which of the followingis true about the use of this drug?

options.A: Can be given alone for acute episodes
options.B: Serum concentration monitoring is not used for dose adjustment
options.C: Cause benign and reversible flattening of T wave on ECG

questions.explanation: Prolonged use of lithium causes a benign and reversible flattening of T-wave.Option A: Lithium is usually not given alone in acute episodes as the onset of antimanic action isslow. Benzodiazepines, anticonvulsants, or atypical antipsychotics are administered along withlithium in the early phases of treatment.Option B: Lithium has a very narrow therapeutic index and monitoring of serum concentration isused for guiding dose adjustment.Option D: Lithium causes significant weight gain.

questions.question: 319A patient on lithium therapy is diagnosed to be hypertensive. Which of the followingantihypertensive drugs is contraindicated here?
questions.explanation: Thiazides are contraindicated in patients who are on lithium therapy.Thiazide diuretics cause significant reductions in Li+ clearance that result in toxic levels.324The K+ sparing diuretics have modest effects on lithium excretion, with a mild increase in serumlevels.Loop diuretics have a limited impact on Li+ serum levels.

questions.question: A patient with a history of mania, on lithium therapy, is brought with complaints of vomitingand multiple episodes of diarrhea. On examination, coarse tremors and an ataxic gait arenoted. What is the expected level of serum lithium in this patient?
questions.explanation: Clinical features are suggestive of lithium toxicity, where serum levels >1.5 mEq/L areconsidered toxic.Lithium has a narrow therapeutic index (0.8-1.2 mEq/L) and therefore requires monitoring tosuspect toxicity. The toxic effects of lithium usually start manifesting when the serum level crosses1.5 mEq/L.Acute intoxication is characterized by:•Vomiting•Profuse diarrhea• Coarse tremors• Ataxia•Coma• Convulsions.A fine action tremor is common in patients taking lithium at therapeutic doses and can develop atany time during treatment. Therapeutic lithium tremor is generally symmetric, limited to thearms, and nonprogressive. Tremor from lithium toxicity is coarser and more disabling, may alsoaffect the legs, and occurs with other symptoms of toxicity.Serious effects of lithium toxicity will involve confusion, hyperreflexia, and seizures. Motor andcognitive side effects can become irreversible with persistent cerebellar tremor being the mostcommon.

questions.question: At what serum lithium levels would you consider dialysis in acute lithium toxicity?
questions.explanation: In acute overdoses, hemodialysis is indicated in:•Serum lithium level is > 4.0 mEq/L• Patients exhibiting symptoms of toxicity.Note: While hemodialysis is considered when serum lithium level is 4.0 mEq/L and above, signs oflithium toxicity usually start showing when the serum level is > 1.5 mEq/L. One should not getconfused between the two.

questions.question: Patients with which of the following conditions do not warrant lithium therapy?
questions.explanation: 325Lithium is not indicated in generalized anxiety disorder.Bipolar disorder is the primary indication for lithium.Option A: Effect of leukocytosis may hasten recovery from cancer chemotherapy-inducedleukopenia and agranulocytosis.Option B: Unipolar depression can be treated with lithium as an adjuvant in resistant cases.Option C: Vasculogenic headaches like cluster headaches.

questions.question: Which of the following must be administered initially in patients with acute mania withpsychotic features?
questions.explanation: In acute mania, even in patients without overt psychotic manifestations, atypical antipsychoticslike olanzapine is used initially for rapid control of psychosis. Atypical antipsychotics are alsoeffective as monotherapy.The therapeutic effects of lithium, carbamazepine, and valproic acid are seen only after a fewdays. Therefore they are effective only with daily dosing with adequate serum monitoring.

questions.question: A patient with mania has been initiated on lithium therapy. While counseling the patientabout the medication, which of the following effects do you mention as the most commonCNS adverse effect?
questions.explanation: The most common CNS adverse effect of lithium in the therapeutic dose range is fine posturalhand tremors. Therapeutic lithium tremor is generally symmetric, limited to the arms, andnonprogressive.Options A and B: Ataxia, slurred speech, and/or incoordination are adverse effects seen duringpeak CNS/serum concentrations. Single bedtime dosing can avoid these adverse effects.Option D: Coarse tremors are seen in case of lithium toxicity and is more disabling and may alsoaffect the legs.

questions.question: A female patient is on first-line pharmacological therapy for bipolar disorder for 6 months.She is fasting for a few days due to religious reasons and presented with seizures, coarsetremors, confusion, and weakness of limbs. Which of the following investigations should bedone to help diagnose her condition?
questions.explanation: The clinical features given in the question are most likely suggestive of lithium toxicity, and henceserum lithium levels should be measured to confirm it.Lithium is a mood stabilizer with a very narrow therapeutic index and is the first line ofmanagement in bipolar disorder.The kidney handles both lithium and Na+ in the same way via ENac channel. Thus duringfasting/dehydration, along with Na+ reabsorption in renal tubules, there will be an increase inthe reabsorption of lithium leading to lithium toxicity.Lithium has a very narrow therapeutic index of 0.8-1.2 mEq/L. The severity of lithium toxicity isoften divided into the following three grades:A fine tremor is common in patients taking lithium at therapeutic doses. Therapeutic lithiumtremor is generally symmetric, limited to the arms, and nonprogressive. The tremor from lithiumtoxicity is coarser and more disabling, may also affect the legs, and occurs with other symptoms oftoxicity. Other adverse effects include mental confusion, hypothyroidism, nephrogenic diabetesinsipidus, and edema.As lithium is readily dialyzed, lithium overdose or toxicity is treated with hemodialysis.*Note - Serum Na+ levels are significant with respect to lithium toxicity, where as serumpotassium levels becomes significant in digoxin toxicity. Hypokalemia increases the risk ofdigoxin toxicity.GradeSr. lithium concentration(inmEq/L)SymptomsMild symptoms1.5-2.5Moderate intoxicatio2.5-3.5nnausea, vomiting, tremor, andfatigueconfusion, agitation, delirium,tachycardia, and hypertoniaSevere intoxication >3.5coma,seizures, hyperthermia,and hypotension

questions.question: A 28-year-old woman on lithium therapy now presents with a positive urine pregnancy test.Which of the following teratogenic effects can be expected in the fetus?
questions.explanation: Lithium use in pregnancy can lead to cardiac defects.Ebstein's anomaly is the specific cardiac defect with lithium use in pregnancy.327In Ebstein's anomaly, the radiological sign seen is a box-shaped heart.Ebstein's Anomaly - box-shaped heartDAILY ROUNDS
